org.jetel.component

Interface RecordTransform

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Transform
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CTLRecordTransform, CTLRecordTransformAdapter, CustomizedRecordTransform, DataRecordTransform, RecordTransformTL

    public interface RecordTransform
extends Transform
    Interface used by all components performing some sort of reformat operation - Reformat, Join, etc.
    For most transformations, it is better to start with subclassing DataRecordTransform class which provides default implementation for most methods prescribed by this interface.

    Order of execution/methods call

    1. setGraph()
    2. init()
    3. transform() for each input&output records pair
    4. optionally getMessage() or signal() or getSemiResult()
    5. finished()

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ALL
      the return value of the transform() method specifying that the record will be sent to all the output ports
      static int ERROR
      Deprecated. 
      use STOP constant instead
      static int OK
      the return value of the transform() method specifying that the record will be sent to the first output port
      static int SKIP
      the return value of the transform() method specifying that the record will be skipped
      static int STOP
      the return value of the transform() method, all values lesser or equal this value are considered as errors

    • Method Detail

      • init

        boolean init(java.util.Properties parameters,
           DataRecordMetadata[] sourcesMetadata,
           DataRecordMetadata[] targetMetadata)
             throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Initializes reformat class/function. This method is called only once at the beginning of transformation process. Any object allocation/initialization should happen here.
        Parameters:
        parameters - component attributes defined for the component which calls this transformation class
        sourcesMetadata - Metadata describing source data records [array]
        targetMetadata - Metadata describing target data record
        Returns:
        True if OK, otherwise False
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • transform

        int transform(DataRecord[] sources,
            DataRecord[] target)
              throws TransformException
        Performs reformat of source records to target records. This method is called as one step in transforming flow of records.
        For example in simple reformat situation, for one input record, one output record has to be generated. Thus for each incoming record, this method is called by Reformat component.
        The number of source records (sources[]) and target records (target[]) depends on particular component configuration. Can be 1:1 , N:1 or N:M.
        Parameters:
        sources - Source DataRecords
        target - Target DataRecord
        Returns:
        RecordTransform.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        RecordTransform.SKIP -- skip the data record(s)
        >= 0 -- send the data record(s) to a specified output port
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined
        Throws:
        TransformException

      • transformOnError

        int transformOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                   DataRecord[] sources,
                   DataRecord[] target)
                     throws TransformException
        Performs reformat of source records to target records. This method is called as one step in transforming flow of records.
        For example in simple reformat situation, for one input record, one output record has to be generated. Thus for each incoming record, this method is called by Reformat component.
        The number of source records (sources[]) and target records (target[]) depends on particular component configuration. Can be 1:1 , N:1 or N:M.
        Called only if transform(DataRecord[], DataRecord[]) throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused transform(DataRecord[], DataRecord[]) to fail
        sources - Source DataRecords
        target - Target DataRecord
        Returns:
        RecordTransform.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        RecordTransform.SKIP -- skip the data record(s)
        >= 0 -- send the data record(s) to a specified output port
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined
        Throws:
        TransformException

      • signal

        @Deprecated
void signal(java.lang.Object signalObject)
        Deprecated. shouldn't be used at all; this method is never invoked and will be removed in short future
        Method which can be used for signalling into transformation that something outside happened.
        For example in aggregation component key changed.
        Parameters:
        signalObject - particular data object - depends on concrete implementation

      • getSemiResult

        @Deprecated
java.lang.Object getSemiResult()
        Deprecated. shouldn't be used at all and will be removed in short future
        Method which can be used for getting intermediate results out of transformation. May or may not be implemented.
        Returns:
